last_episode_to_air.name: Wet Boys
last_episode_to_air.overview: Michelle talks Billy Joel and crows in a double dose of monologues, promotes a sustainable car fuel and previews the next hit true crime documentary.

name: The Break with Michelle Wolf
overview: Nobody's safe as Michelle Wolf unapologetically takes aim in this weekly topical show that blends sketches with live comedy and in-studio guests.

episodes.name: Strong Female Lead
episodes.overview: In her premiere, Michelle tackles the week's news, debuts a steely movie heroine and joins guest Amber Ruffin to lampoon the pressure to have kids.

episodes.name: Be Honest
episodes.overview: Michelle goofs on the latest happenings on the internet, comes up with new hashtags for the #MeToo movement and welcomes Neal Brennan to "be honest."

episodes.name: Bad Opinions
episodes.overview: Michelle riffs on the headlines, delivers overdue apologies with a sultry twist and visits the eclectic fellow behind The New York Times opinion page.

episodes.name: Hate It or Love It
episodes.overview: Michelle touches on the latest with North Korea, unveils a new snack just for men and sorts out strong feelings with special guest Hannibal Buress.

episodes.name: Entertainment Explosion!
episodes.overview: Michelle makes the best of a rough week in the news, roasts a bunch of shady politicians and rips on sensationalism in TV journalism.

episodes.name: Perfect Sports
episodes.overview: In the wake of being called "unhinged," Michelle takes aim at confident white guys, responds to calls for civility and talks sports with Nick Kroll.

episodes.name: How Dare You!?
episodes.overview: As Michelle commemorates the Fourth of July, she salutes women's rights, gives tips on being a hero and welcomes Seth Meyers to play "How Dare You?"

episodes.name: Sincere and Angry
episodes.overview: Michelle pokes fun at overblown comedy-show desk-segment commentary, shares a tricky new bathroom contraption and gets creeped out at movie night.

episodes.name: I Pledge Allegiance
episodes.overview: After praising Serena Williams, Michelle pledges allegiance to a new country, promotes a new safety product and looks into why people are joining ICE.

episodes.name: Wet Boys
episodes.overview: Michelle talks Billy Joel and crows in a double dose of monologues, promotes a sustainable car fuel and previews the next hit true crime documentary.
